content: Ironically, when this student posted these videos on TikTok three days ago, he not only did not receive praise for the embassy and sympathy from local international students, but was instead abused by patriotic netizens because he looked like a Chinese-Jewish hybrid living in Kaifeng, Henan, and was suspected of being an "Israeli spy". He was also abused by patriotic netizens and was brutally opened by patriotic netizens. He was also insulted in private messages as a "Jewish devil"

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
[The Chinese Embassy in Israel chose to warn between evacuating Chinese citizens and appeasing them] On October 15, the chat records of the Israeli study abroad group circulated on the Internet showed that the embassy still had no news about when to evacuate Chinese citizens, and the embassy basically did not respond to any questions, while the official media was still mocking Japan's evacuation and fake news. At the same time, the remarks of the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Wang Yi today were also shameful. Other countries around us have evacuated their citizens, only the Chinese have not left. 
The only thing the embassy has done now is to call those who spoke fiercely in the group to warn them not to talk nonsense. And not to allow everyone to discuss the situation in the group. 
Some students joked that the embassy chose to warn between evacuating Chinese citizens and appeasing them.

content:
No innuendo
On October 16, the recently popular "Chongzhen: The Diligent King Who Lost His Country" was notified that it would be removed from the shelves due to printing problems.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Weibo CEO Wang Gaofei said that in the past few years, the traffic of official media in the field of social current affairs has accounted for more than 80%, but it has dropped sharply in the past two years.
This shows that people would rather believe the conspiracy theories and rumors of patriotic big Vs than believe the official media.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: On October 6, Foreign Ministry Spokesperson Mao Ning expressed the hope that local Chinese citizens in Israel would take commercial flights back to China as soon as possible. This was also a response to the local Chinese citizens and students stranded in Israel who questioned why the embassy did not take action.
